etymologies: late 16th century: from Middle Dutch wijsseggher ‘soothsayer’, probably from the Germanic base of wit. The assimilation to acre remains unexplained

definitions: a person with an affectation of wisdom or knowledge, regarded with scorn or irritation by others; a know-it-all

examples.text: the wiseacres forecast a collapse of the building

shortDefinitions: person with affectation of wisdom or knowledge
